sub_title: Ecologist by Avesper & Illustrator by Kipke
summary: I'm a MSc Biology student at the Wageningen UR with emphasis in adaptation & behavioural biology, especially on birds. I have worked on a territorial inventory of the Black-Tailed Godwit (Limosa limosa limosa) in  Bothnian Finland and biosystematical analysis on the genus Accipiter. Now I will focus on the effects of asymetric mold on flight of the Pied Flycatcher. I hope to continue working on avian species after my graduation.

projects.title: Bird Course - Vogelcursus
projects.description: As we felt there was a gab in the educational system in terms of ornithology, we decided to take matters in our own hands and organized a bird course. This course consisted of 5 evenings with both a bird recognition lecture and a guest lecture on a bird-related subject (evolution, conservation, morphology, migration and patterns & colors in feather-displays). The course evenings attracted on average 70 students. Due to its success there are already plans to continue this course annually.

profile_positions.description:
Guiding university students of the courses 'Mens en Dierkunde' I & II (Human and Animal science I & II) and 'Principles of Human Physiology' throughout their practicals. Morphological and histological subjects of various organ systems are covered in both theory and dissection of the dogfish and piglet. 

Occasionally assisting course-independent practicals to high school or university students, which alternately includes dissection (pig/snake) or assembling pig skulls.

profile_positions.description: Providing DNA practicals at 21 High Schools (Atheneum) throughout the Netherlands. Hereby characteristics of a potato plant are exposed by isolating specific genes using Nitrogen, PCR-techniques and Gel Elektroforesis.
profile_positions.title: Mobile Practicals & traveling DNAlabs: 'Prenatal' plant research
